results.title: Le Crime de la Mule Noire = the Crime at the Black Mule Inn
results.brief_description:
Following his escape from the Bicetre prison, Vidocq arrives in a small village where a crime has just been committed. Vidocq is mistaken for Inspector Flambard and decides to test his police skills by investigating what really happened at the Black Mule Inn.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Bruno Balp, Jacqueline Danno.

results.title: Le Chevalier de Maison Rouge = the Cavalier Maison Rouge
results.brief_description:
Paris, 1793. Maurice Lindey, a young and fervent revolutionary rescues a mysterious woman from the clutches of the citizen’s army. That same night, Maison Rouge makes an attempts to have the Queen and the royal family escape from the Prison du Temple and a handsome reward is offered for his capture. Lindey follows the musterious woman, only to learn that her name is Genvieve Dixmer and that she is married to the owner of a tannery. Maurice is ivited to the house and recived as a firend. He is far too in love to realise that the house is full of conspirators. He even goes as far as introducing Genevieve to the Queen. When she is caught with a message for the Queen, again, Maurice covers for Genevieve and falls under the suspicion of his revolutionary friends.

Credits: Producer, Robert Paiilardon ; director, Claude Barma ; writers, Jacques Armand, Claude Barma ; photography, Jacques Lemare ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Annie Ducaux, Jean Desailly, Francois Chaumette, Julien Berthau, Dominique Paturel, Anne Doat, Michel Leroyer.

results.title: Le Chaud Lapin = the Hot Rabbit
results.brief_description:
William is a relentless womaniser who has to leave his many conquests behind to go and spend the summer vacation in a country house with relatives of one of his friends. Stranded in the isolated rural cottage, he attempts to bed every female member of the clan. Unsuccessful and extremely frustrated, he is determined to have some fun on his vacation and abandons the whole group in pursuit of a trio of hippyish females who flirted with him earlier.

Credits: Director, Pascal Thomas ; writers, Jacques Lourcelles, Pascal Thomas, Hubert Watrinet ; photography, Colin Mounier ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Bernard Menez, Daniel Ceccaldi, Brigitte Gruel.

results.title: Le Chat et la Souris = the Cat and the Mouse
results.brief_description:
Richard, a philandering financier, is found murdered in his luxurious riverside mansion. Precious paintings have also disappeared. Inspector Lechat is put in charge of the investigation and immediately suspects Richard’s wife of eliminating her husband. As Lechat investigates her alibi, he becomes increasingly attracted to ‘the mouse’.

Credits: Director, Claude Lelouch ; writer, Claude Lelouch ; photography, Jean Collomb ; music, Francis Lai.
Cast: Serge Reggiani, Philippe Leotard, Michele Morgan, Valerie Lagrange, Jean-Pierre Aumont.

results.title: Le Chapeau de L'empereur = the Emperor's Hat
results.brief_description:
Police chief Henry is working hard to have Vidocq promoted to head of Police Services. A few days before an official visit by Napoleon, the Police Museum is burgled and the Emperor’s hat is stolen. Flambard is designated to take the blame and resign, unless he can recover the precious hat before the visit. To do so, Flambart has no choice but to ask help from his old enemy, Vidocq.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Louis Arbessier, Gabriel Gabin, Robert Bazil, William Sabatier.

results.title: Le Capitaine H
results.brief_description: We follow the “Genevilliers”, a petrol barge, along the River Seine from the throbbing harbour to the mellow arches of Paris. Life bounded by the ever-changing banks has its own special kind of freedom. Captain Michael hacke and his family see the river in different weathers, colors and moods. They feel a unique brotherhood with their fellow river dwellers, a chance meeting with relatives is an occasion for celebration. No matter how the life of a bargee may change with time, the river remains a world unto itself. Commentary in English. Photography by Roger Fellous and jean-Jacques Languepin. Music by Jean Wiener.

results.title: Le Caillou
results.brief_description: A documentary about New Caledonia, which shows the nickel plant, and the inroads mining has made on the environment. Traditional forms of agriculture are shown, as well as the traditions of village life. These continue despite the French presence in the territory and the effects of nearly a century of resource exploitation on New Caledonia’s environment. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Le Bossu = the Hunchback
results.brief_description:
Lagardere vows to protect Aurore, the baby daughter of his friend, Philippe de Nevers, who has just been murdered by his cousin Gonzague, who was coveting his fortune. Falsely accused of the murder, Lagardere swears he will seek to avenge his friend and help Aurore recover her fortune and rank in society. This favourite swashbuckling adventure has also been filmed by Andre Hunebelle (1960) and Philippe de Broca (1997).

Credits: Producer, Jason Regina ; director, Jean Delannoy ; writer, Bernard Zimmer ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Georges Auric.
Cast: Paul Bernard, Pierre Blanchar, Yvonne Gaudeau, Jean Marchat, Lucien Nat, Helene Vercors.
